page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY KIBWORTH
page.content:
{OLD HARCOURT}
First settled in the Iron Age, a farming community developed during Roman times and the Munt, a local curiosity, was probably a burial mound of a wealthy farmer from that period. Strips of farmland in later times shaped the local fields and after the Norman invasion the land was given to the de Harcourt family. The original Domesday survey of 1086 shows an early medieval village with boundaries very similar to those of today. The settlement then was surrounded by a ditch and mound with a timber palisade to keep out wild animals. The houses were wooden and mud huts with thatched roofs, the old House still surviving from 1678 being the first brick one in the village.
